DZ.name: Algeria
DZ.motto: By the people and for the people
keyFacts: Rich in oil and gas reserves

EG.name: Egypt
keyFacts: Home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
95% of population lives along the Nile
Suez Canal connects Mediterranean and Red Sea

NG.name: Nigeria
NG.motto: Unity and Faith, Peace and Progress

geography.climate: Equatorial in south, tropical in center, arid in north

KE.name: Kenya
keyFacts: Great Rift Valley runs through country

geography.climate: Tropical along coast, arid in interior

ET.name: Ethiopia
ET.motto: Ethiopia Stretches Her Hands unto God

GH.name: Ghana
keyFacts: First sub-Saharan country to gain independence
Home to Elmina and Cape Coast castles

CI.name: Côte d'Ivoire
keyFacts: Home to the Basilica of Our Lady of Peace (largest church)

geography.climate: Tropical along coast, semi-arid in north

TZ.name: Tanzania
keyFacts: Home to Mount Kilimanjaro (Africa's highest peak)

MA.name: Morocco
keyFacts: Only African country with both Atlantic and Mediterranean coastlines
Home to the oldest university in the world (University of Al Quaraouiyine)

UG.name: Uganda
keyFacts: Home to half of the world's mountain gorillas
Over 50% of population under 15 years old
Most biodiverse country per square kilometer in Africa

SN.name: Senegal
SN.motto: One People, One Goal, One Faith
keyFacts: Home to the African Renaissance Monument

CM.name: Cameroon
keyFacts: First African country to reach FIFA World Cup quarter-finals

MW.name: Malawi
keyFacts: Home to the 'Lake of Stars' (Lake Malawi)
Major producer of tea and tobacco

AO.name: Angola
keyFacts: Second largest oil producer in Africa
Home to the giant sable antelope
Kalandula Falls among Africa's largest waterfalls

geography.climate: Semiarid in south to tropical in north

RW.name: Rwanda
keyFacts: First country with majority female parliament

BW.name: Botswana
keyFacts: World's largest diamond producer by value
40% of land dedicated to wildlife conservation
One of Africa's most stable democracies

ML.name: Mali
ML.motto: One People, One Goal, One Faith

NA.name: Namibia
keyFacts: Home to the Namib Desert (world's oldest)
First country to include environmental protection in constitution

LR.name: Liberia
LR.motto: The Love of Liberty Brought Us Here
keyFacts: Home to the world's second largest shipping registry

TN.name: Tunisia
keyFacts: World's largest exporter of olive oil

ZM.name: Zambia
keyFacts: One of world's largest copper producers

SL.name: Sierra Leone
keyFacts: Founded as home for freed slaves (Freetown)
Third largest natural harbor in the world

NE.name: Niger
keyFacts: World's highest fertility rate (7 children per woman)

GA.name: Gabon
keyFacts: Oil-rich with high GDP per capita

ER.name: Eritrea
keyFacts: Only African country with no official language

TD.name: Chad
keyFacts: Named after Lake Chad (shrunk by 90% since 1960s)
Oldest human skull found (7 million years)

BJ.name: Benin
keyFacts: Pendjari National Park (West Africa's best wildlife)

ZW.name: Zimbabwe
keyFacts: Home to Victoria Falls (shared with Zambia)
